title: ‘The Masked Singer’ Reveals Identity of Paparazzo: Here Is the Celebrity Under the Costume
description: SPOILER ALERT: Details follow for Season 13, Episode 10 of “The Masked Singer,” “Lucky 6,” which aired April 16 on Fox. Freeze frame: “Boy Meets World” and “Brotherly Love” star Matthew Lawrence was the latest celebrity to be revealed on Season 13 of Fox’s “The Masked Singer.” On the show’s Wednesday episode, Lawrence was unmasked […]
author: Varietyschneider
excerpt: On "The Masked Singer" Season 13 Episode 10 "Lucky 6 Night,” a celebrity was revealed as Paparazzo. Here's who was under the mask.
text: SPOILER ALERT: Details follow for Season 13, Episode 10 of “The Masked Singer,” “Lucky 6,” which aired April 16 on Fox. Freeze frame: “Boy Meets World” and “Brotherly Love” star Matthew Lawrence was the latest celebrity to be revealed on Season 13 of Fox’s “The Masked Singer.” On the show’s Wednesday episode, Lawrence was unmasked as Paparazzo after performing “Unpretty,” by TLC. “Man, if you had told me that this little guy would still be standing here, I’d say you’re crazy. Because I’ve never sang before,” Lawrence said as Paparazzo in his pre-tape package. “And — big spoiler alert — the next song is the biggest hint to my identity yet. So listen closely.” That’s referring to Lawrence’s relationship with TLC member Rozonda “Chilli” Thomas. Popular on Variety For Paparazzo, Jenny McCarthy-Wahlberg got it right with Matthew Lawrence. Robin Thicke guessed Frankie Muniz. Rita Ora named Jason Ritter. Ken Jeong went with Ben Savage. Matthew Lawrence as Paparazzo joins Erika Jayne as Yorkie, Method Man as Stud Muffin, Candace Cameron Bure as Cherry Blossom, James Van Der Beek as Griffin, Flavor Flav as Space Ranger, Sheana Shay as Bat, Aubrey O’Day as Ant, Oscar de la Hoya as Fuzzy Peas and Cedric the Entertainer as Honey Pot as the celebrities unmasked on “The Masked Singer” Season 13. “Lucky 6” night brought together final two contestants standing from Group A (Coral and Paparazzo), Group B (Pearl and Boogie Woogie) and Group C (Mad Scientist Monster and Nessy). Back for Season 13 are host Nick Cannon, alongside panelists Jenny McCarthy Wahlberg, Ken Jeong, Rita Ora and Robin Thicke. Ora was at the desk for a third consecutive season to fill in for Nicole Scherzinger. New this season, a mysterious masked character dubbed “Detective Lucky Duck” will appear throughout the season to give clues and help the panelists “quack” the case of who’s under the masks. Also new: The “Crack the Case” clue cases, in which more clues are shared about the eliminated contestant. For Paparazzo, the clue was a reptile zoo. “I have a reptile zoo, it’s right in my backyard. If you don’t believe me, ask my famous family.” Meanwhile, back is the Golden Ear trophy is back in play for the panelists (whomever has the most correct guesses this season will win). “The Masked Singer” Season 13 themed episodes include a tribute to franchises “Shrek” and “Ghostbusters,” as well as the Grand Ole Opry as it hits its 100th anniversary. Also on tap are a tribute to the Rat Pack and themes such as “Voices of Olympus: Unmasking of the Gods,” “Carnival,” “Boy Bands,” “Decades,” “Lucky 6 Speed Guessing,” a “Clash of the Masks” and the return of “Soundtrack of My Life.” Masked contestants in Season 13 include Honey Pot, Space Ranger, Cherry Blossom, Coral, Fuzzy Peas, Ant, Paparazzo, Griffin, Boogie Woogie, Pearl, Bat, Yorkie, Stud Muffin, Nessy and Mad Scientist Monster. Here were the performances on Wednesday’s Episode 10, “Lucky 6”: Mad Scientist Monster, “The Masked Singer” (Michael Becker/Fox) Mad Scientist Monster Song: “There’s Nothing Holdin’ Me Back,” by Shawn Mendes Panel guesses: Kenny Chesney, Trace Adkins, Tim McGraw Colossal clue: A Tennessee flag. Rapid fire Q&A: What kind of car do you drive? “A Ford Raptor.” How do you spell your name? “M-O-N-S-T-E-R.” Have you won any awards from singing? “Yes, many of them.” Are you younger than Ken? “Way younger.” Mad Scientist Monster voiceover: “If you’ve been doing your research, you know I’ve basically told you everything about me. I’ve played sports, I love my wife, and I didn’t get here alone. And while you guys are close to solving the equation, there are still some holes in your theories because — spoiler alert — I am not Keith Urban. But we have shared a stage together. Now here’s a colossal clue that will drive you mad.” Previous songs: “Unwell,” by Matchbox Twenty; “I Swear,” by All-4-One; “Love Yourself,” by Justin Bieber Previous panel guesses: Luke Combs, Luke Bryan, Blake Shelton, Alan Jackson, Tim McGraw, Keith Urban, Brad Paisley, Billy Ray Cyrus Nessy, “The Masked Singer” (Michael Becker/Fox) Nessy Song: “Stargazing,” by Myles Smith Panel guesses: Edwin McCain, Sting, Dave Matthews Colossal clue: “Touring 2025: Baton Rouge, LA; Littleton, NC; Nashville, TN; Florence, SC; Augusta, GA; Rockford, IL; Portsmouth, NH; Carteret, NJ; Boca Raton, FL.” Rapid fire Q&A: Are you friends with Bigfoot? “Yeah, he always clogs my shower though.” Do you have any kids? “Yeah, it feels like 100.” What’s your favorite social media platform? “TikTok.” Do you follow Jenny? “Absolutely.” You have a famous love song by chance? “Arguably one of the most famous.” Nessy voiceover: “I really stuck my neck out coming into this competition. I’m usually a pretty quiet guy, but being back in the spotlight again has made me feel like a total star. And the guesses for me have been huge rock lessons. But big spoiler alert — I am not Pat Monahan. Sorry, Ken, you’re gonna have to get off that train.” Previous songs: “Roxanne,” by The Police; “Tearin’ Up My Heart,” by *NSYNC; “Can’t Fight This Feeling,” by REO Speedwagon Previous panel guesses: Gene Simmons, Dan Reynolds, Daryl Hall, Dave Matthews, Darius Rucker, Pat Monahan Coral, “The Masked Singer” (Michael Becker/Fox) Coral Song: “Ain’t It Fun,” by Paramore Panel guesses: Rachel Zegler, Selena Gomez, Brittany Snow Colossal clue: The Anonymouse played by Demi Lovato. Rapid fire Q&A: You’re part of a huge franchise, which one? “It’s in your same family.” What’s your connection to Anonymouse? “It’s the happiest place on Earth.” When were you born? “On a Tuesday.” Are she and Rita friends? “No.” Do you come from a famous family? “No.” Coral voiceover: “I’m having the time of my life being here. Performing is something I’ve wanted to do more of, so getting this chance has been awesome. You guys have been guessing some of the biggest pop stars in music, but big spoiler alert — I can do more than just sing. In fact, you know me from a huge franchise.” Previous songs: “Mad World,” by Tears for Fears; “Accidentally in Love,” by Counting Crows; “Luck Be a Lady,” by Frank Sinatra Previous panel guesses: Bebe Rexha, Carly Rae Jepsen, Sabrina Carpenter, Halsey, Anna Kendrick, Dove Cameron, Hailee Steinfeld, Lili Reinhart, Victoria Justice, Rachel Zegler, Camila Mendes Paparazzo, “The Masked Singer” (Michael Becker/Fox) Song: “Unpretty,” by TLC Panel guesses: Jason Ritter, Ben Savage, Matthew Lawrence Colossal clue: Danielle Fishel (star of “Boy Meets World”) Rapid fire Q&A: Have you ever been on a TV show? “Oh yeah, lots.” Have you ever been on TMZ? “Oh yeah.” Did you ever have a poster of Jenny McCarthy on your wall? “Of course, who didn’t?” Have you ever met Rita Ora at a Hollywood party? “No, I don’t get to go in the parties.” Do you like Ken Jeong movies? “Of course, they’re the best. Funniest guy alive right there.” Paparazzo voiceover: “Man, if you had told me that this little guy would still be standing here, I’d say you’re crazy. Because I’ve never sang before. And — big spoiler alert — the next song is the biggest hint to my identity yet. So listen closely.” Previous songs: “The Door,” by Teddy Swims; “Hallelujah,” by Leonard Cohen; “That’s Amore,” by Dean Martin Previous panel guesses: Taron Egerton, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Kieran Culkin, James Marsden, Seth Green, Elijah Wood, Cole Sprouse, Michael Cera, Henry Thomas, Matthew or Andrew Lawrence Pearl, “The Masked Singer” (Michael Becker/Fox) Pearl Song: “Conga,” by Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine Panel guesses: Faith Hill, Jody Watley, Lisa Lisa, Joan Jett, Pat Benatar Colossal Clue: Elvis. Rapid fire Q&A: Are you Sheryl Crow? “No.” Because you’re Madonna? “Come on!” What’s your favorite food? “Candy.” What’s your favorite “Hangover” movie? “The first one.” Are you a gold record holder? A little better than that. Forget your first name, what’s your last name? “Jam.” Pearl voiceover: “I came into this competition determined to show a side of myself no one has ever seen before. And it’s been wonderful opening up. But, spoiler alert — while I love her music, I’m not Shania Twain.” Previous songs: “Saving All My Love For You,” by Whitney Houston; “(Don’t Fear) The Reaper,” by Blue Oyster Cult; “Here You Come Again,” by Dolly Parton Previous panel guesses: Regina King, Shania Twain, Joan Jett, Madonna, Melissa Etheridge, Sheryl Crow, Trisha Yearwood, Kellie Pickler, Carrie Underwood Boogie Woogie, “The Masked Singer” (Michael Becker/Fox) Boogie Woogie Song: “Unsteady,” by X Ambassadors Panel guesses: Chris Martin, Darren Criss, Ryan Tedder,  Colossal Clue: Statue of Liberty with an acoustic guitar. Rapid fire Q&A: Do you ever not smile? “No, always smiling.” Can you actually roller blade? “Of course, I’m dressed like this.” Are you famous for your voice? “100%.” Have we ever guessed you on the show before? “Wouldn’t you like to know!” What’s your favorite sport? “Basketball.” Have you ever been publicly heartbroken? “100%.” Has Jenny ever interviewed you on MTV? “No, but I wish.”  Have Jenny ever interviewed you on her radio show? “No but I wish again, let’s do this already!” Boogie Woogie voiceover: “I gotta say, I never anticipated enjoying a competition like this so much. But, spoiler alert — there’s no one enjoying this more than my kids. Everything I do is for them. And I can’t wait for the moment where we all sit on the couch, and they realize it was me under here the whole time!” Previous songs: “I Believe In a Thing Called Love,” by the Darkness; “Radioactive,” by Imagine Dragons; “Something in the Water,” by Carrie Underwood Previous panel guesses: Adam Lambert, Andy Samberg, Mika, Criss Angel, Neil Patrick Harris, Jason Mraz, George Clooney, Ryan Tedder, Gavin DeGraw, Josh Groban In Season 12, Boyz II Men (as the Buffalo) won the Masked trophy, beating out Mario, as the Wasp, who was this season’s runner-up. They joined AJ Michalka as Strawberry Shortcake; Kobie Turner as Goo, Jana Kramer as Royal Knight, Bronson Arroyo as Sherlock Hound, Drake Bell as Ice King, Bethany Hamilton as Macaron, Natalie Imbruglia as Bluebell, Laverne Cox as Chess Piece, Andy Richter as Dusty Bunny, Paula Cole as Ship, Marsai Martin as Woodpecker, Yvette Nicole Brown as Showbird and John Elway as Leaf Sheep as the celebrities unmasked on “The Masked Singer” Season 12. “The Masked Singer” comes from Fox Alternative Entertainment. Rosie Seitchik, Craig Plestis and Cannon are executive producers, while Seitchik serves as showrunner. The series is based on the South Korean format created by Mun Hwa Broadcasting Corp.
html:
SPOILER ALERT: Details follow for Season 13, Episode 10 of “The Masked Singer,” “Lucky 6,” which aired April 16 on Fox.

Freeze frame: “Boy Meets World” and “Brotherly Love” star Matthew Lawrence was the latest celebrity to be revealed on Season 13 of Fox’s “The Masked Singer.” On the show’s Wednesday episode, Lawrence was unmasked as Paparazzo after performing “Unpretty,” by TLC.

“Man, if you had told me that this little guy would still be standing here, I’d say you’re crazy. Because I’ve never sang before,” Lawrence said as Paparazzo in his pre-tape package. “And — big spoiler alert — the next song is the biggest hint to my identity yet. So listen closely.”

That’s referring to Lawrence’s relationship with TLC member Rozonda “Chilli” Thomas.

Popular on Variety

For Paparazzo, Jenny McCarthy-Wahlberg got it right with Matthew Lawrence. Robin Thicke guessed Frankie Muniz. Rita Ora named Jason Ritter. Ken Jeong went with Ben Savage.

Matthew Lawrence as Paparazzo joins Erika Jayne as Yorkie, Method Man as Stud Muffin, Candace Cameron Bure as Cherry Blossom, James Van Der Beek as Griffin, Flavor Flav as Space Ranger, Sheana Shay as Bat, Aubrey O’Day as Ant, Oscar de la Hoya as Fuzzy Peas and Cedric the Entertainer as Honey Pot as the celebrities unmasked on “The Masked Singer” Season 13.

“Lucky 6” night brought together final two contestants standing from Group A (Coral and Paparazzo), Group B (Pearl and Boogie Woogie) and Group C (Mad Scientist Monster and Nessy).

Back for Season 13 are host Nick Cannon, alongside panelists Jenny McCarthy Wahlberg, Ken Jeong, Rita Ora and Robin Thicke. Ora was at the desk for a third consecutive season to fill in for Nicole Scherzinger.

New this season, a mysterious masked character dubbed “Detective Lucky Duck” will appear throughout the season to give clues and help the panelists “quack” the case of who’s under the masks.

Also new: The “Crack the Case” clue cases, in which more clues are shared about the eliminated contestant. For Paparazzo, the clue was a reptile zoo. “I have a reptile zoo, it’s right in my backyard. If you don’t believe me, ask my famous family.”

Meanwhile, back is the Golden Ear trophy is back in play for the panelists (whomever has the most correct guesses this season will win).

“The Masked Singer” Season 13 themed episodes include a tribute to franchises “Shrek” and “Ghostbusters,” as well as the Grand Ole Opry as it hits its 100th anniversary. Also on tap are a tribute to the Rat Pack and themes such as “Voices of Olympus: Unmasking of the Gods,” “Carnival,” “Boy Bands,” “Decades,” “Lucky 6 Speed Guessing,” a “Clash of the Masks” and the return of “Soundtrack of My Life.”

Masked contestants in Season 13 include Honey Pot, Space Ranger, Cherry Blossom, Coral, Fuzzy Peas, Ant, Paparazzo, Griffin, Boogie Woogie, Pearl, Bat, Yorkie, Stud Muffin, Nessy and Mad Scientist Monster.

Here were the performances on Wednesday’s Episode 10, “Lucky 6”:

Mad Scientist Monster

Song: “There’s Nothing Holdin’ Me Back,” by Shawn Mendes

Panel guesses: Kenny Chesney, Trace Adkins, Tim McGraw

Colossal clue: A Tennessee flag.

Rapid fire Q&A: What kind of car do you drive? “A Ford Raptor.” How do you spell your name? “M-O-N-S-T-E-R.” Have you won any awards from singing? “Yes, many of them.” Are you younger than Ken? “Way younger.”

Mad Scientist Monster voiceover: “If you’ve been doing your research, you know I’ve basically told you everything about me. I’ve played sports, I love my wife, and I didn’t get here alone. And while you guys are close to solving the equation, there are still some holes in your theories because — spoiler alert — I am not Keith Urban. But we have shared a stage together. Now here’s a colossal clue that will drive you mad.”

Previous songs: “Unwell,” by Matchbox Twenty; “I Swear,” by All-4-One; “Love Yourself,” by Justin Bieber

Previous panel guesses: Luke Combs, Luke Bryan, Blake Shelton, Alan Jackson, Tim McGraw, Keith Urban, Brad Paisley, Billy Ray Cyrus

Nessy

Song: “Stargazing,” by Myles Smith

Panel guesses: Edwin McCain, Sting, Dave Matthews

Colossal clue: “Touring 2025: Baton Rouge, LA; Littleton, NC; Nashville, TN; Florence, SC; Augusta, GA; Rockford, IL; Portsmouth, NH; Carteret, NJ; Boca Raton, FL.”

Rapid fire Q&A: Are you friends with Bigfoot? “Yeah, he always clogs my shower though.” Do you have any kids? “Yeah, it feels like 100.” What’s your favorite social media platform? “TikTok.” Do you follow Jenny? “Absolutely.” You have a famous love song by chance? “Arguably one of the most famous.”

Nessy voiceover: “I really stuck my neck out coming into this competition. I’m usually a pretty quiet guy, but being back in the spotlight again has made me feel like a total star. And the guesses for me have been huge rock lessons. But big spoiler alert — I am not Pat Monahan. Sorry, Ken, you’re gonna have to get off that train.”

Previous songs: “Roxanne,” by The Police; “Tearin’ Up My Heart,” by *NSYNC; “Can’t Fight This Feeling,” by REO Speedwagon

Previous panel guesses: Gene Simmons, Dan Reynolds, Daryl Hall, Dave Matthews, Darius Rucker, Pat Monahan

Coral

Song: “Ain’t It Fun,” by Paramore

Panel guesses: Rachel Zegler, Selena Gomez, Brittany Snow

Colossal clue: The Anonymouse played by Demi Lovato.

Rapid fire Q&A: You’re part of a huge franchise, which one? “It’s in your same family.” What’s your connection to Anonymouse? “It’s the happiest place on Earth.” When were you born? “On a Tuesday.” Are she and Rita friends? “No.” Do you come from a famous family? “No.”

Coral voiceover: “I’m having the time of my life being here. Performing is something I’ve wanted to do more of, so getting this chance has been awesome. You guys have been guessing some of the biggest pop stars in music, but big spoiler alert — I can do more than just sing. In fact, you know me from a huge franchise.”

Previous songs: “Mad World,” by Tears for Fears; “Accidentally in Love,” by Counting Crows; “Luck Be a Lady,” by Frank Sinatra

Previous panel guesses: Bebe Rexha, Carly Rae Jepsen, Sabrina Carpenter, Halsey, Anna Kendrick, Dove Cameron, Hailee Steinfeld, Lili Reinhart, Victoria Justice, Rachel Zegler, Camila Mendes

Song: “Unpretty,” by TLC

Panel guesses: Jason Ritter, Ben Savage, Matthew Lawrence

Colossal clue: Danielle Fishel (star of “Boy Meets World”)

Rapid fire Q&A: Have you ever been on a TV show? “Oh yeah, lots.” Have you ever been on TMZ? “Oh yeah.” Did you ever have a poster of Jenny McCarthy on your wall? “Of course, who didn’t?” Have you ever met Rita Ora at a Hollywood party? “No, I don’t get to go in the parties.” Do you like Ken Jeong movies? “Of course, they’re the best. Funniest guy alive right there.”

Paparazzo voiceover: “Man, if you had told me that this little guy would still be standing here, I’d say you’re crazy. Because I’ve never sang before. And — big spoiler alert — the next song is the biggest hint to my identity yet. So listen closely.”

Previous songs: “The Door,” by Teddy Swims; “Hallelujah,” by Leonard Cohen; “That’s Amore,” by Dean Martin

Previous panel guesses: Taron Egerton, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Kieran Culkin, James Marsden, Seth Green, Elijah Wood, Cole Sprouse, Michael Cera, Henry Thomas, Matthew or Andrew Lawrence

Pearl

Song: “Conga,” by Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine

Panel guesses: Faith Hill, Jody Watley, Lisa Lisa, Joan Jett, Pat Benatar

Colossal Clue: Elvis.

Rapid fire Q&A: Are you Sheryl Crow? “No.” Because you’re Madonna? “Come on!” What’s your favorite food? “Candy.” What’s your favorite “Hangover” movie? “The first one.” Are you a gold record holder? A little better than that. Forget your first name, what’s your last name? “Jam.”

Pearl voiceover: “I came into this competition determined to show a side of myself no one has ever seen before. And it’s been wonderful opening up. But, spoiler alert — while I love her music, I’m not Shania Twain.”

Previous songs: “Saving All My Love For You,” by Whitney Houston; “(Don’t Fear) The Reaper,” by Blue Oyster Cult; “Here You Come Again,” by Dolly Parton

Previous panel guesses: Regina King, Shania Twain, Joan Jett, Madonna, Melissa Etheridge, Sheryl Crow, Trisha Yearwood, Kellie Pickler, Carrie Underwood

Boogie Woogie

Song: “Unsteady,” by X Ambassadors

Panel guesses: Chris Martin, Darren Criss, Ryan Tedder, 

Colossal Clue: Statue of Liberty with an acoustic guitar.

Rapid fire Q&A: Do you ever not smile? “No, always smiling.” Can you actually roller blade? “Of course, I’m dressed like this.” Are you famous for your voice? “100%.” Have we ever guessed you on the show before? “Wouldn’t you like to know!” What’s your favorite sport? “Basketball.” Have you ever been publicly heartbroken? “100%.” Has Jenny ever interviewed you on MTV? “No, but I wish.”  Have Jenny ever interviewed you on her radio show? “No but I wish again, let’s do this already!”

Boogie Woogie voiceover: “I gotta say, I never anticipated enjoying a competition like this so much. But, spoiler alert — there’s no one enjoying this more than my kids. Everything I do is for them. And I can’t wait for the moment where we all sit on the couch, and they realize it was me under here the whole time!”

Previous songs: “I Believe In a Thing Called Love,” by the Darkness; “Radioactive,” by Imagine Dragons; “Something in the Water,” by Carrie Underwood

Previous panel guesses: Adam Lambert, Andy Samberg, Mika, Criss Angel, Neil Patrick Harris, Jason Mraz, George Clooney, Ryan Tedder, Gavin DeGraw, Josh Groban

In Season 12, Boyz II Men (as the Buffalo) won the Masked trophy, beating out Mario, as the Wasp, who was this season’s runner-up. They joined AJ Michalka as Strawberry Shortcake; Kobie Turner as Goo, Jana Kramer as Royal Knight, Bronson Arroyo as Sherlock Hound, Drake Bell as Ice King, Bethany Hamilton as Macaron, Natalie Imbruglia as Bluebell, Laverne Cox as Chess Piece, Andy Richter as Dusty Bunny, Paula Cole as Ship, Marsai Martin as Woodpecker, Yvette Nicole Brown as Showbird and John Elway as Leaf Sheep as the celebrities unmasked on “The Masked Singer” Season 12.

“The Masked Singer” comes from Fox Alternative Entertainment. Rosie Seitchik, Craig Plestis and Cannon are executive producers, while Seitchik serves as showrunner. The series is based on the South Korean format created by Mun Hwa Broadcasting Corp.
